lead_paragraph: Next for Disney: Aida as Musical Walt Disney Theatrical Productions, flush from the success of ''The Lion King,'' has decided that its next project, as rumored, will be a retelling of the Aida legend with 19 new songs by Elton John and Tim Rice. The musical, called ''Elaborate Lives: The Legend of Aida,'' will have its world premiere on Sept. 11 in the 800-seat auditorium of the Alliance Theater in Atlanta under the direction of Robert Jess Roth. If it works, Disney hopes to bring the show eventually to New York.
abstract: On Stage and Off column; Disney's next musical will be Elaborate Lives: The Legend of Aida, retelling of original story with songs by Elton John and Tim Rice; director is Robert Jess Roth, with premiere set for September at Atlanta's Alliance Theater; producer Bill Kenwright will bring London production of Ionesco's Chairs to Broadway for 12-week run; Ralph Waite is rehearsing Death of a Salesman, at Paper Mill Playhouse, and also running for Congress in California, to fill seat of late Sonny; Waite, Democrat, ran and lost in 1990; photo; Anna Deavere Smith cancels West Coast performances of her new play House Arrest, because subject matter is too close to scandal involving Pres Clinton's alleged relationship with White House intern; American Express gives $1.5 million to Arts and Business Council to help 1,000 nonprofit theaters in New York and seven other cities (S)
